name: The Desmond Albany

reviews.text: I was here for 1 night for a regional business meeting and the place is very large, spacious and had plenty of rooms for us to have our meetings in.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Large Event

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was clean, a bit dated and kind of dark (as i had one looking over the inside courtyard...).
reviews.title: No place better in Albany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok and staff seemed pleasant.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at a unique hotel

reviews.text: I don't know if i will be in the area again, but if you are looking for a place to have an event with a lot of people, that is convenient, this would be a good spot.
reviews.title: Fun for New Years

reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a romantic weekend at the Desmond in Albany. Our room was clean and beautiful with colonial period furniture, king size canopy bed and a balcony overlooking the courtyard. We ate at Simpsons and enjoyed a delicious dinner and breakfast the following morning. We also stopped by the Tavern and found all of the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The room service was also awsome and quick! Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful and it was nice to have a little change from the normal hotel room. The service was great and the staff was very accommodating. It was nice overlooking the courtyard. I would definitely come back again.
reviews.title: We loved the Desmond! The food was out of this world and with the three resturants there is something for everyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Desmond for Valentine's day this year for our weekend getaway. We purchase the "Romance package" which for $199, you get a beautiful king room with balcony and 4 poster bed, a $70 gift card for any food service in house and a room service of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.
reviews.title: The perfect blend of comfort and elegance!

reviews.text: Arriving at the desmond, you can see the charming brick entrance from the exit off the interstate and you immediatly hope that this is your destination, they do offer valet service however, we decided to park ourselves. As you enter, you are greeted by the scent of a wood burning fireplace, and are surrounded by the dark woods and greeted by the doorman and guest service personell at the desk.
reviews.title: Desmond Caters to Your Needs

reviews.text: We were checked in quicky and efficiently, and asked what time we would like our champagne delivered.
reviews.title: Wedding was amazing!

reviews.text: When we entered our room on the third floor, the beauty and intricacy of the furnishings over take you, as well as the balcony that beckons you to come sit on it. When sitting on the balcony, even though it is actually indoors, you FEEL like you are outside on a summer day, and although it sounds crazy, you feel that nice summer breeze too!
reviews.title: Unique and Charming Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Desmond enroute from Montreal to Philadelphia. The hotel was spectacular. We felt like we had been transported to colonial williamsburg. The rooms were spotless. The dinner was excellent and very reasonable. The room was very comfortable, the staff was great.
reviews.title: THE BEST HOTEL
Catering & Banquet Service was one of the worst I have ever encounterd in Business
reviews.text: Dear GM,
I wanted to take this opportunity to let you know about a recent experience at your property.
reviews.title: Service made the whole stay worth while!
very dissapointed in lack of professionalism in staff
reviews.text: I referred a business associate of mine to your hotel for small but very important meeting that we were both hosting. The meeting room was not set up properly and more importantly from beginning to end the Banquet Staff was ""Sloppy and and Service was the worse I have had in my career. We were both embarrassed and management did not anticipated any of our needs. Candy wrappers on the floor, finger smear marks on the Water pictures etc, and asked for the Banquet Manager and was told you don't have one???

His accommodations were fine, however our experiences in your lounge and restaurant as well were a total disaster. the attitude of the staff, the general cleanliness, and food quality were an embarrassment. I was left with the impression that you have no leadership in that area of your hotel... Surely with a community like ours you can attract some talented management to run your operations?
reviews.title: Unique and classy
Nice, Unique Hotel in Albany
reviews.text: This hotel is colonial style from the outside and from the inside a courtyard resembling what could be a village in a Charles Dickens novel. There are two indoor pools, one with an excellent hot tub. The rooms are a bit dated even with the colonial theme. The lobby is warm and inviting with a fireplace and pool table lounge. The main restaurant, Scrimshaw, has nice decor and offers great service and even better food. There is a less fancy restaurant which is also good, especially for breakfast. Rooms overlooking the indoor courtyard are best. One big minus is that there are often weddings, business meetings which seem to take over the complex at certain times. This can be very annoying. Location of this hotel is great...next to airport (no noise), close to 2 major malls, a lot of great restaurants nearby.

Our family attend a birthday family here and they held it on the orange court i believe the server are very flat affect no emotions at all. they said its one of the best here in albany well i guess they are loosing their grip now coz i think the place need a make over.
reviews.title: stuck up staff dont look happy with their job

reviews.text: The Desmond was the perfect place to stay for my Arbonne Conference! Rooms were clean and staff was very friendly
reviews.title: Great place to stay for conference. Jacuzzi was awesome!!

reviews.text: Very impressed however there is no valet parking and our room was really far from the lobby. Would definitely return. A solid 3 star. VG Dining.
reviews.title: Best in Albany

reviews.text: Have been required to be here often and the place first charms, then irritates and then becomes a reliable, comfortable home. The food portions are HUGE and the quality can be great - or just tasty but lacking in veg. Breakfast starts at 7 and there's no grab-a-yoghourt-and-go - but there is a Starbucks in easy walking distance if weather is clement. Internet access is now available but, if without own machine, in-room in-tv is far too expensive and cumbersome so use the (small) business centre. If mobility is a problem, let them know as the walk to the back rooms is more of a hike than a walk. Also, ask if you wish to be put somewhere away from the participants in weddings and bar mitzvahs - the public rooms are well sound-proofed but the corridors are not. If you do not have a car, there is a bus stop right outside and $1.50 can get you a very long way if you can negotiate the online Albany bus timetable.
reviews.title: Olde style

description: The Desmond is Albany's premier hotel and conference center in the heart of Tech Valley. The landmark hotel is conveniently located within minutes of the Albany International Airport (ALB) at the crossroads of I-87, I-90 and downtown Albany. The Desmond offers elegance and charm with contemporary comfort in a business friendly environment. Voted 2013 "Best Local Hotel" six consecutive years by the Times Union Newspaper readers. Discerning and seasoned travelers appreciate the hotel's modern amenities and smoke-free environment. The hotel offers 323 elegantly appointed guest rooms and suites. Guests can choose from deluxe spacious accommodations; two queen beds or a California king bed option or executive, junior, duplex and presidential suites. Hotel amenities including: complimentary WiFi, complimentary parking and local/airport shuttle, on-site ATM, indoor pool with Jacuzzi, fitness center, 24-hour business center, room service, billiard room and gift shop. Our exquisite ballrooms and indoor atria are stunning venues for weddings, other social events and business meetings. The hotel offers over 28,000 square feet of attractive event space encompassing 22 function rooms and boardrooms. Guests of The Desmond enjoy an excellent choice of cuisine at three popular restaurants: Scrimshaw, a AAA Four Diamond-rated fine dining experience offering classical Continental cuisine, Simpson's Grille, casual dining for breakfast, lunch and dinner and The Tavern, an English pub complete with a sprawling copper bar, flat screen televisions and comfortable table seating for cocktails and lite fare. We invite you to be our guest. A one-of-a-kind hotel awaits you at The Desmond.
